alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 12:50PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN UMATILLA... SOUTHEASTERN WALLA WALLA AND SOUTHWESTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM PST... At 1249 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Walla Walla, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Walla Walla, Dixie, and Kooskooskie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains
